description:
TUXEDO Pulse 14 Gen4 is here about five and a half months after TUXEDO Pulse 14 Gen3 introducing the 4 nm AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS processor with 8 cores and 16 threads, 24 MB cache (L2+L3), 54 W TDP, up to 5,1 GHz clock speed, and the Radeon 780M graphics with 12 GPU cores and […]

The post TUXEDO Pulse 14 Gen4 Laptop Arrives with AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS and Radeon 780M appeared first on Linux Today.
title: TUXEDO Pulse 14 Gen4 Laptop Arrives with AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS and Radeon 780M

description:
Amarok is a music player from KDE that pretty much dropped off our radar these past few years, as it didn’t receive any regular updates, with the last stable update being back in 2018.

The post Amarok Music Player Has Been Revived With a New Qt 5 Port appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Amarok Music Player Has Been Revived With a New Qt 5 Port

description:
The latest stable GStreamer 1.24.3 release fixes critical bugs in multimedia handling, including HLS and EXIF issues.

The post GStreamer 1.24.3 Enhances Stability and Security in Latest Update appeared first on Linux Today.
title: GStreamer 1.24.3 Enhances Stability and Security in Latest Update

description:
openSUSE Leap 15.6 RC is now available for download, including the long-awaited Cockpit for admin tasks.

The post openSUSE Leap 15.6 RC Is Now Available appeared first on Linux Today.
title: openSUSE Leap 15.6 RC Is Now Available

description:
Nitrux developer Uri Herrera announced today the release and general availability for download of Nitrux 3.4.1 as a new ISO snapshot of this Debian-based, systemd-free, and immutable GNU/Linux distribution that focuses on the KDE Plasma desktop environment.

The post Nitrux 3.4.1 Released with Linux Kernel 6.8, Gamescope, OpenRazer, and More appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Nitrux 3.4.1 Released with Linux Kernel 6.8, Gamescope, OpenRazer, and More

description:
Lennart Poettering reveals run0 in systemd v256, a fresh take on secure privilege escalation, aiming to phase out traditional SUID binaries.

The post Systemd v256 Introduces run0, a Safer Alternative to sudo appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Systemd v256 Introduces run0, a Safer Alternative to sudo

description:
Immich 1.103.0 self-hosted photo solution brings read-only sharing, jump-to-date functionality, and enhanced memory views.

The post Immich 1.103.0 Unveils New Features and Fixes appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Immich 1.103.0 Unveils New Features and Fixes
